channel.title: 7-Zip: all about it!
channel.description: Does anyone know why after downloading the file and attempting to extract I get a message that says that the file is empty?

item.title: 7-Zip: all about it!
item.dc:creator: uncle_revie
item.description:
Set:

Every mirror site i’ve checked only has .zip files, do you know of one that has all 3?

ive edited my post as i relaise i could be wrong and have another suggestion mentioned above

Read full topic

item.title: 7-Zip: all about it!
item.dc:creator: Set
item.description:
uncle_revie:

you cannot extract the zip file, some mirrors have 3 parts of the Black Mesa Source Install files and a few mirrors have it all combined into one zip file.

There are 3 files a .7z which contains the main files, a .md5 file and a exe file.
Downloading the 3 files and running the .exe file from the same folder wills tart the install for you.

As far as i know the german mirror is the only mirror to combine all 3 files into one zip file.

Every mirror site i’ve checked only has .zip files, do you know of one that has all 3?

Read full topic

item.title: 7-Zip: all about it!
item.dc:creator: instinx
item.description:
Well, for me there was a BlackMesa-Setup.exe I just had to install it by clicking on that.

Read full topic

item.title: 7-Zip: all about it!
item.dc:creator: uncle_revie
item.description:
try downloading it to a different location on your hard drive.

Windows is notorious for copying downlaoded files from the temp download folder if it has the same name as the one your downloading.

Also if it says the file is empty it might not have downlaoded correctly.

Ive noticed that the downlaod servers are very busy so it could easily drop your connection.

I suggest the best way is to download the torrent file this is like a download manager but will ensure you have all the files you need. you will need a torrent downlaoder such as bit torrent to do this.

hope this helps

Read full topic

item.title: 7-Zip: all about it!
item.dc:creator: Set
item.description:
I’ve downloaded this mod 4 times from 4 different mirrors, every file has the same problem. Whenever I try to extract the files I get an error message saying that the folder is either empty or that the files cannot be extracted.

Can anyone help?

Read full topic

item.title: 7-Zip: all about it!
item.dc:creator: waste1
item.description:
Issue happens for sure when you try to install from network disk. Try to copy installation files (all 3 of them) to your local disk and run exe file. Should be fine. At least worked for me.

1201×634 48.4 KB

Read full topic

item.title: 7-Zip: all about it!
item.dc:creator: Cutter_McKay
item.description:
I downloaded all three files. I verified that all 3.07GB of the .7z file is there. I start the Setup, and it says “Could not find BlackMesa.7z – did you download it?”

It’s there. Can someone tell me where the extractor is looking for it? Currently the file is in my downloads folder, C:\user"username"\downloads. Do I need to move it to a certain folder for the extractor to see it?

Thanks in advance,

-Cutter

It’s ok, I figured it out. For anyone else who has had this problem, (because I’ve seen in asked in a few other forums as well): When I downloaded it the first time, it crashed. So I downloaded it again, and my computer automatically named the file “blackmesa.7z(1)”. That’s why the setup couldn’t recognize it. Just right click the file and rename it to “blackmesa.7z”. BOOM!

Read full topic

item.title: 7-Zip: all about it!
item.dc:creator: Spacefish
item.description:
nowayintheday92:

Okay So the download for 2 parts took 3 hours

And When I go to Extract it it says its “The archive is either in unknown format or damaged”

Now what Do I do?

I just want to play those Downloads took Hours and All I get is this?

You may try the torrent download. Its very fast and the file integrity is checked… If there are wrong parts they are redownloaded!

Just start your torrent download, quit the torrent client, move your currently downloaded file to the torrent download file (replace it) and restart the torrent client. It shoudl validate your file and download the missing / damaged parts.

Read full topic

item.title: 7-Zip: all about it!
item.dc:creator: Mutto
item.description:
Alright, I changed the name of the install and that seems to have worked for some reason… All I did was name it “BMS2” before attempting an install. Maybe the installer is faulty and just took a couple of attempts to unpack everything correctly and it just HAPPENED to work when I changed the name? No idea.

Now I can finally play!
=D

Read full topic

item.description:
I redownloaded and that solved it for me.

I originally downloaded on Transmission for OS X then moved the files over to Windows on a USB stick, this time I just downloaded with µTorrent on Windows itself. I think there might be a problem with the USB stick as other files have come out strangely after being transferred via it.

item.title: 7-Zip: all about it!
item.dc:creator: christob1972
item.description:
Rymdskepp:

Try doing it manual. Reply if there is any issues.

OK, I figured it out. It was probably just missing the MD5 hash; without that, the setup program doesn’t know what to do with the 7z file.

item.title: 7-Zip: all about it!
item.dc:creator: elijahdl
item.description:
xpac:

Either try 7Zip, if that doesn’t help - redownload.
That happens sometimes when servers are under heavy pressure with a lot of people downloading (although it shouldn’t). Then you have no option then to redownload…

I tried both the GameFront and the Moddb servers; both are giving me invalid archives.

Read full topic

item.title: 7-Zip: all about it!
item.dc:creator: TerminalVeracity
item.description:
When trying to install, after a time I am presented with this in the log:

Sub item Errors: 6558
Failed to extract files. 7-Zip returned error code: 2

…and the only option I have is to cancel the install. Tried running as admin, with and without Steam open, download all of the Source SDK tools available, no change.

Any idea why this is happening or how I can fix it? I hope I don’t have to download it all again…

Read full topic

item.title: 7-Zip: all about it!
item.dc:creator: xpac
item.description:
Well, WinRAR can open 7Zip files, so the .7z might show up to you as a WinRAR file.
Turn on file extensions, if you haven’t, and check if you actually have an .7z file, if .7z and .exe are in the same folder…

Read full topic

item.title: 7-Zip: all about it!
item.dc:creator: xpac
item.description:
If this happens to you, most likely your downloaded file is corrupt and you need to re-download it

Either try 7Zip, if that doesn’t help - redownload.
That happens sometimes when servers are under heavy pressure with a lot of people downloading (although it shouldn’t). Then you have no option then to redownload…

Read full topic
